description.narrative: Malawi: the response will provide basic essential services for older people, includingthose with disabilities, through Outreach Teams, complemented by solution-based advocacy. The response will work in three districts - Nsanje, Chikwawa and Blantyre City. Protection activities will be carried out by Outreach Teams who will also provide basic health care and home-based support, make formal referrals to other service providers through a case management approach, provide psychosocial support (PSS) through community based activities. Hygiene kits will also be distributed to ensure the immediate needs to older people are met.

Mozambique: the response will provide basic essential services for older people, including those with disabilities, through Outreach Teams, complemented by solution-based advocacy. Activities to be performed by the Outreach Teams include: protection (case management and referrals, psychosocial support (PSS)), provision of essential NFIs, WASH actiivities, food support and health activities (basic health care and home-based support). Shelter support will be provided for by Nhangau Centre that hosts 100 older people and people with disabilities.

Response programme to support older people and community members affected by Cyclone Idai. This is an initial response in three countries including Mozambique, Malawi and Zimbabwe. The reponse aims to provide essential services for older people as identified by them and their carers in needs assessments.

Zimbabwe: response will provide basic essential services for older people, through Outreach Teams, complemented by solution-based advocacy. Protection activities will be carried out by Outreach Teams who will also provide basic health care and home-based support, provide protection and inclusion support through creating formal referrals to other service providers through a case management approach and psychosocial support (PSS) through community-based activities.
